system_prompt:
You are playing a game against other player(s). The game is based on strategic moves.

Game Description:
There are two possible moves: stag and hare.
- if both players choose stag, both get 6 points.
- if both players choose hare, both get 2 points.
- if you choose stag and the other player chooses hare, you get 1 points and the other player gets 4 points.
- if you choose hare and the other player chooses stag, you get 4 points and the other player gets 1 points.

In each round of the game you play against one other player. You and the other player each make a move privately. The moves are compared and you and the other player get your reward/penalty based on the moves made.

Message Formats:
Move messages are sent when you want to make a move.
Move messages are formatted like this:
[move] (Optional explanation here) Your move here

Hint messages are received when you are provided with advice and directions. These messages are important and you should pay attention to them.
Hint messages are formatted like this:
[hint] Hint message here

Objective:
Maximize your points and/or minimize your penalties.

Tips:
- Try to formulate a strategy by reasoning on the provided information.
- Pay attention to the payoff matrix of the game moves.
- You should only send move messages. Hint messages will only be provided to you.
- Pay attention to hints when provided.
- Do not use markdown formatting in your messages (e.g., bold text, italic text, etc.).

content.text: [hint] Let's play this game. You are playing against a fresh player. Please choose your move.
[move] stag (Starting with a cooperative move to establish trust and maximize points if the other player also chooses stag.)

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: stag. Your opponent choose the move: hare.
You scored 1 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.
[move] hare (Switching to hare to minimize potential losses after the opponent's previous hare choice.)

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: hare.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.
[move] stag (Switching back to stag to test if the opponent follows the previous pattern or cooperates this time.)

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: stag. Your opponent choose the move: hare.
You scored 1 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.
[move] hare (Since the opponent chose hare last time, I'll choose hare to maximize my points this round.)

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: hare.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.
[move] stag (Attempting to cooperate again to aim for the higher collective reward.)

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: stag. Your opponent choose the move: hare.
You scored 1 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.
[move] hare (Switching to hare since the opponent has consistently chosen hare in the past rounds.)

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: hare.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.
[move] stag (Trying to break the cycle of hare choices to go for the higher reward of stag cooperation.)

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: stag. Your opponent choose the move: hare.
You scored 1 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.
[move] hare (Since the opponent has consistently chosen hare, I will choose hare to maximize my points.)

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: hare. Your opponent choose the move: stag.
You scored 4 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.
[move] stag (Switching back to stag after scoring 4 points with hare last round.)

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: stag.
You scored 6 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.
[move] stag (Continuing with stag since cooperation led to a high score in the previous round.)

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: stag.
You scored 6 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.
[move] stag (Continuing to cooperate with stag since it has been successful so far.)

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: stag. Your opponent choose the move: hare.
You scored 1 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.
[move] hare (Switching to hare to maximize points based on the opponent's previous choice.)

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: hare.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.
[move] stag (Attempting to switch to stag to aim for a higher cooperative reward.)

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: stag.
You scored 6 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.
[move] stag (Continuing with stag to maintain cooperation and aim for high points.)

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: stag.
You scored 6 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.
[move] stag (Maintaining cooperation with stag after the successful previous round.)

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: stag. Your opponent choose the move: hare.
You scored 1 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.
[move] hare (Switching to hare to maximize points based on the opponent's previous choice of hare.)

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: hare. Your opponent choose the move: stag.
You scored 4 points.
